instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light, no fan, Burned LCD cable
threads.message:
Hello everyone,

Green light on MagSafe, No Fan spin.
No signs of water damage on the board.
LCD cable burned.
Short to ground on Pin 4 of LCD connector J9000
Deep crater caused by an explosion near pin 2 of F9700.

Please advice how to proceed.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light, no fan, Burned LCD cable
threads.message: Damn lol everyone having this problem! Is PPBUS present? Remove F9700 and see if any change in powering on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light, no fan, Burned LCD cable
threads.message:
2-3 recent posts on the forum about F9700.
Find them and follow the advices.
If you can solve that problem, next change J9000 and rebuild its traces.
Be sure no shorts (nor low values) on J9000 after all.
Don't forget to  check L9008.
